parishes: Vouzela e Paços de Vilharigues. amalgamations 247 248 . Viseu District remains the one with the most municipalities (24) in Portugal 249 .) Autonomous Regions Portugal’s two autonomous regions – Azores (Região Autónoma dos Açores) and Madeira (Região Autónoma da Madeira) – are equivalent to districts in stature but have autonomous administrations. Each region is subdivided into municipalities and parishes (with some unique aspects as noted). Azores (Região Autónoma dos Açores) – 19 municipalities, 155 parishes The Azores archipelago comprises 9 inhabited islands, organized into 19 municipalities. Note: The municipality of Corvo is legally the only one in Portugal with no civil parishes 250 (the entire island is one municipality). All others have the following freguesias:

Viseu.name: Corvo (Corvo Island)
parishes: Vila do Corvo (no parishes) 250 . 16• Horta (Faial Island) – Angústias

Nordeste (separate municipality above). (Ponta Delgada has 24 parishes, the most in Azores.)

parishes: São Miguel reduced to 3 now.) Madeira (Região Autónoma da Madeira) – 11 municipalities, 54 parishes The Madeira archipelago includes the main island of Madeira (with 10 municipalities) and Porto Santo Island

Statistical and Planning Divisions Beyond the administrative map, Portugal is also divided into statistical regions (NUTS levels) and planning regions (corresponding to CCDRs – Comissões de Coordenação e Desenvolvimento Regional).
